text: Volzhsky () is an industrial town in Volgograd Oblast, Russia. It is on the east bank of the Volga River and its distributary the Akhtuba. It is northeast of Volgograd. Population: 321,479 (2021 estimate).https://rosstat.gov.ru/storage/mediabank/tab-5_VPN-2020.xlsx == History == Volzhsky was founded in 1951. It had around 10,000 people at the time. It was given city status in 1954. The main reason for its large growth was the making of the Volga Hydroelectric Station. == Twin towns – sister cities == Volzhsky is twinned with: * Cleveland Heights, United States * Mönchengladbach, Germany * Collegno, Italy * Lianyungang, China * Shaker Heights, United States == References == Category:Cities and towns in Volgograd Oblast
title: Volzhsky, Volgograd Oblast
